newsitem.title: USA: NIMO says 610 MW NY nuke nears full power.
newsitem.headline: NIMO says 610 MW NY nuke nears full power.

text.p: Niagara Mohawk Power Corp's (NIMO) 610 megawatt (MW) Nine Mile Point 1 nuclear power station is expected to return to full power later today, the company said Friday.
"The unit's at 92 percent power. We're in power ascension, and we should reach full power later today," said company spokesman Alberto Bianchetti.
The feedwater pump problems that closed the unit on August 18 have been resolved, he said.
Nine Mile Point, located in Scriba, N.Y., produces about three percent of NIMO's electricity deliveries. The utility provides power to about 1.5 million customers in upstate New York.
